comments.body:
Finally, a unique mob that punishes villager murder, As Iron golems were kinda easy.

 

My way of seeing the bounty hunter Is that they're a human NPC, similar to the player. They have 20 HP and have a very complex AI. they carry Healing potions, as well as potions of speed, strength, and regeneration, and In higher search parties, they will wear Iron and ever so rarely Diamond armor. They could carry by choice a sword or axe for up close combat but either own bows or crossbows When far enough.

This mob could drop 1-3 leather, their ranged weapon,  4-6 emeralds, 1-4 random positive potions and rarely their armor, and even more rarely their weapon... There could be a 15% chance they could also be using shields.

 

As for search parties, you'll start to be ambushed by 1 or 2 while running around the area, minding your business. But If the bounty Is at It's peak, groups of 7 or even 11 will raid your home. They can open doors, target your pets, and even understand redstone, so survival will be difficult..

 

Overall, good Idea, dude.

Yeah I agree that it shouldn't be a villager that comes to hunt the player because the villagers a 100% peaceful (which is why there are iron golems) how ever I disagree with the idea that they should continue to come back because the player needs a way for the Bounty hunters to stop showing up without the player having to die and lose their XP level and potentially their items.

I like the idea, with it being the villager equivalent of Illager patrols and raids against those who kill innocent vallagers, though the bounty hunters would likely need to not be villagers as villagers are peaceful. As Reynaldo suggested, perhaps a humanoid NPC, though I would suggest maybe not exactly human. Perhaps smaller, faster, golem like humanoids equipped with sword & shield, axe, or bow. Perhaps they could be clay or wood golems and the weapon's quality could start at iron, with a rare chance that they carry diamond weapons.
Mod
This is an amazing idea for villager law and how about when theres a bounty on your head you get a banner on top of you?

I like this idea a lot. But, what if this was one instance of bounty hunting. What if the player was a bounty hunter and took jobs from a bounty board, for either killing mobs or collecting materials within a time limit? I saw this in a mod and it was pretty cool, because these bounties gave you buffs whenever you entered a village, similar to hero of the village.
I never thought of that very creative I would love to be able to costumes the iron golems in game great idea

Super creative bro! I always find suggestions on how we should have new golems in general and this makes so much sense and would be super fun. Plus the ability to now heal iron golems now will makes this idea sound even better.
This is a great idea but I’m a little concerned it might make the golem too strong
Great idea! Golems haven’t really had any love since they were added so long ago.

A quick little side note: there are concerns this could make golems a little too powerful, but that’s the reason why you’ll need end-game items to equip the golems. It gives more of a reason to hunt for them. For example, almost nobody is going to hunt for a heart of the sea, so if you can hunt for it to upgrade an iron golem it’ll give the player incentive to actually try and find a heart of the sea and reap the great reward

Awesome Idea and I totally agree with your last comment!
If an Iron Golem with an Ender Dragonhead isnt total badass  it wouldnt worth the effort

Well, currently you can give an iron golem iron to heal it, so maybe clicking it but with one of these items changes it? Or alternatively you might need to apply it would it is being built? For the dragon head you could use it in place of the pumpkin, for the heart of the sea tho? Maybe place it on the block center of iron with a item frame? (So it is the 'heart' of the iron golem?) And as for the nether star... I'm not sure? I might actually say 3 nether stars one on each block in the direction the the pumpkin head is facing (with an item frame) in reference to the 3 heads of a wither

I like this idea as you can customize iron golems. However, like all mobs, there should be a weakness and strengths. For example, a Heart of the Sea golem would constantly be damaged and weakened and slowed in fire/lava/hot biomes, but can swim and be faster and stronger in water. The Nether Star golem would explode when the nether star takes several direct hits, and would have the weakness and strength of a heart of the sea golem, except reversed. The ender dragon head golem has a chance to accidentally explode itself .

I think this really is a good way to give variety to golems and also another reason to go on adventures to find rare items! Plus, I think players should be able to customise golems by right-clicking on them with dyed leather tunics or other armors, to make them wear it. It can be only a visual change (for leather tunics) or a slight defense boost (diamond armor), just to spice up golems

Love these ideas! I think a Nether Star should have a iron golem turn into like a darker color and give it buffs like more strength. And then a Heart of the Sea would give it more health!

Both of these should also sorta be visible at the center of the golem too, with the Heart of the Sea being a blue orb with a yellow heart to show it's repurposed itself from a conduit and then the star should be in cool  glowing fragments around wires
Fits in with their personality of being greedy, kind of like goblins
It shud trade flowers, bottels, honney and more. The bees maiby coud polinate cactus in deserts, ore it’s djust a bad idea. Sorry my spelling.
I think it’d be the perfect new villager job! They could harvest beehives without triggering their release, and they could sell honey/beeswax and other similar things!
I just thought of this today and decided to see if anyone else had the same idea. Glad I am not the only one. I think this is the perfect new villager trade
I think the iron golem should do that.
I think that a villager with Builder profession could do that
And mine

It's like locking people out of villager mechanic cause they play on lower difficulty for me i can't do it cause my server admin won't change it to hard so i don't get good discounts if i do i might lose the villager that sucks. D:

Yeah, He's right, on hard, you can have a villager be in a room with a zombie, the zombie will "kill" the villager with the death sounds happening as soon as the villager is changed, after that, I kill the zombie, and trap the ZV in a boat. It might work on lower difficulties, but if you can, turn it to hard. Thanks Ray! P.S, ZV=Zombie Villager

Just lost a fletcher with a weakness arrow trade when I tried infecting him.

I traded ~200 villagers up to master to get him, and lost him in an instant due to this.

Wish someone would make a resource pack that allows it to be 100% when infecting villagers. I lost up to 3 stacks of emeralds making my armorer give the 1 iron for 1 emerald trade. Please send me a resource pack if you have one.

Yes it seems like it makes villagers harder to play with on easier levels, like if your on easy your guaranteed that the villager you’ve been working with will die with no chance of saving them. I’d understand like maybe on easy mode zombies wouldn’t pathfinder to villagers or something but this logic always confused me. Also makes it more annoying to play on a server in medium difficulty that I can’t change the difficulty of.
This could be flat world only feature as you don't need in regular survival.
I wish they would add to wondering traders a bucket of lava. Then alone with drip stone you could get an infinite source of lava on superflat bedrock. Then you could make cobblestone.

i enjoy this idea! cats spawn in the usual villager towns, why not have a special place for foxes?

perhaps the "Willager's Cottages", as you call it, would generate in the different variants of the taiga biomes, to keep in line with the spawn pattern of the foxes.
Turtle1over102, thats the idea
Where did you get the name willagers from

I think this would be fitting in a cherry blossom biome; I believe there is somewhere you can go in Japan (or another Asian region if I'm mistaken) where domesticated foxes roam around, and tourists can interact with them.

AntacidCave7722, Well I thought 'what name can I give them that close enough to not sound like an illager' and then I came up with willager. Actually the double-you gave me the idea for them to be two of them, the two v's that form the double-you made me think of 2 so I made it so. (vv) Like a double villager.
I love this idea, Mojang, please add this! :D
I love this idea! Also, willagers seems like kind of a weird name. Maybe something different, like "Naturalists" or something. Idk. But I LOVE the idea
I like the idea, but laser vision seems to much, don't you think?
Not really, because guardians have laser vision
less laser vision but the ash and spawning seems great
sure guardians have laser vision, but they only spawn in a specific location, not just anywhere.
They must be a so dangerous mob. Check out my illager bone post.

I'd think they would be a special illager that is neutral and spawns near, but not in, villages. It would look like a villager, but with a cloak os something to indicate that they've been thrown out by the villagers, or more accurately, by the iron golem, at the decision of the villagers. They would carry weak weapons and be vulnerable to monsters, and maybe they start raids on their own. They may trade with the player and with wandering trader, but what they really want is a home...
Maybe instead of iron, it wields a netherite sword. Those are more scary
This is a great idea with great cosmetics!
Хорошая идея!

Perhaps they only imprison the traders with bad trades, so those traders learn their lesson, and they trade with other wandering traders, who would have a chance of spawning at the top of the outpost. After all, the wandering traders are not defined as a villager or illager, so maybe they are something in between...
There could be Zombified Wandering Traders. You could find them in Igloos
It's better to give the player 1 item free. But, it can be useful only when w.trader will get useful trades and you will really want to get smth.
I can see them living in igloos that have a fireplace in the centre
I add your idea if its ok
maybe they would have dogsleds and snow mobiles
I hope that they’ll have sledding.
So, they don't morph into actual warrior Villagers, but are still Pillagers running a protection racket? Mobagers? Like it. Nice!
What if you could hand an iron golem a rose, and it would hand it to the illager, who would become passive and gain nitwit villager AI?
That’s the best idea I’ve ever heard!
They have illagers that are villagers in Minecraft legends no why not minecraft.

I think this undermines the already useless wandering traders too much, and I believe that potion/ingredients trades should already be available via clerics.
Finally, I don't think they should get a new banner, as it won't do anything, or even signify much, compared to the ominous one.
Overall, I don't think it's unique enough to add to the game. Maybe, if there were different uses making it more interesting I'd vote.
I think this would be so cool!! Definitely support it. (Especially if the cats can be tamed if separated from the witch/witch gets killed anyway)
But that could spread them everywhere because if there physicaly confined in artic biomes there will be a breakout around the world
They don't break out through the world, they basically only spawn when you're in the arctic.
This would be very cool. We have mobs for ocean, end, nether, and normal overworld. We have one mob for snowy/ice biomes which is the polar bear.
Sounds like an hostile op snow golem.
This is in a mod already
good idea, but only rarely and only in ice spikes biomes.
shoot you will cost some cracking sounds.
Do they spawn in raids? If they do, which wave? If not, why called an illager? Also, does this mob have to be an illager? Can it just be some greedy animal?
This sound like a cool idea but it doesn't sound very vanilla, but it would be cool to see a more vanilla version of this in minecraft
385638684332 I suggest you put updates in the post, instead of in the comments, in-case there are a lot of comments and yours gets washed away.
As part of a raid maybe.  Not a random spawn.  Really don't want all my food stolen when I'm not looking.
How about making him have a invisibility potion that he can sometimes drink to sneak into your houses?

If your gone for a long time, will he steal your house (ex: sleep in your bed, use your things, and live in your house)

also, this guy sounds like a hobo.
It should be called a hermit
It could spawn as often as Pillager Patrols before 1.14.3 (every 5 minutes)
You have muy vote
You have my vote
Needs some info here. How do people "properly take care of villagers"?
The time in which they spend in the dark should vary, but it should still be between 10 and 15 days. Same with the light level.
No.

One can take care of villagers by insuring that they’ve got beds to go back at night so that they don’t get sleep deprived and turn insane.

Also make sure that villagers feel safe by always having a golem in town. If there are no golems for a long time the villagers could stop work. And after more days the villagers will go insane.

Maybe villagers need to eat. You don’t need to feed them yourself. Villagers would eat as long as there is a chest with food such as carrots, potatoes etc. A village would spawn with such a food chest and a villager that collects foods from the farmer and inserts them. If there food chest is destroyed villagers could turn after 2 ingame weeks insane. To prevent that the player just needs to insure that the chest is there and that the farmer does its job.

I like this idea certain conditions that must be met in order for villagers to not turn I'll. I like the suggested conditions associated with sleep, hunger, or lighting. Here's some other ideas.
1. Social interaction, villagers that cannot gossip will go insane due to loneliness.
2. Villager must have enough space, if a villager is trapped in a small cell and cant travel a certain distance from their bed or cannot be in direct sunlight they turn.
3. Biome dependency, if biome specific villagers are brought out of their biome they turn. Snowy villagers must have access to snow blocks etc.
4. Lack of jobs, maybe a nitwit is a villager about to turn. Villagers without a job or sense of purpose are more likely to become Illagers, or a villager will revert to a nitwit before completely turning as a warning that a condition is not being met.
5. Reputation, if your reputation falls to historic lows the village could turn on you.
6. Lack of iron golems or cats, if villagers cant "play" with their iron golems or cats they get depressed and become more likely to turn.
7. Water source, villagers have to have access to some sort of water source to drink.
I think there should be need to be multiple conditions unfulfilled for a villager to turn or a specific condition unfulfilled for a long time. This would discourage players from having trading halls that resemble jails. If you want to be able to trade you have to take care of your villagers and keep them happy or they will revolt against you.
Illagers aren't ill. The are just angry at pure-blood humans for torturing them for being half-witch

Probably taking care of a villager is a pretty overwhelming,I mean,when you play Minecraft you have other things to do,not take care of your villagers.Now I'm not saying that this is a bad idea,but I don't agree,because adding something else that the players need to worry about,would be just too much and eventually everyone would stop doing it.

I'm sorry, FartherChunk668, but the REAL point of this idea is that there is no way TO keep the villagers as your slave labor-force: you can leave them in their villages in perfect safety and security, coming into the town only to trade for supplies and needed goods, but this labor-camp style captured villager trading would be a thing of the past, and you would very shortly have a massive slave revolution on your hands. That, I think, is the entire idea, the players HAVE TO stop 'caring for' the villagers, and just let them live out their simple agrarian lives in their villages as Iuz intended.

Secondo me oltre questo consiglieri pure di avere su tutte le versione, il modo per renderli pacifico dai vendicatori hai pillagers, considerando anche il per attirare più giocatori, bisognerebbe 1 creare anche dei piccoli di pillager e stregoni sempre dando la possibilità al giocatore di educarli . Per i Villagers secondo me servirebbe una evoluzione per quanto riguarda il loro livello di intelligenza .!!!
smart idea
No

Look dude, I get that villager rebalancing is a nerf, but it needs to be done. Villager trading is too OP. There are always options to play in a different version without this rebalancing, but it definitely needs to be added and be the default.

I think this needs to be kept as optional as well. If you like it, great, but that doesn't mean everyone else does. I don't think it should be the default. That way the people who do like it can switch it on and the ones who don't like it don't have to. Just because you think it's too overpowered doesn't mean that you need to force others who enjoy the benefits of villagers to stop enjoying them, especially considering that you can't switch versions in Bedrock.

Responding to the comment above. I'm sorry to say this, but just because you don't like a change doesn't mean it shouldn't be applied universally through the game for its own health and economy. Villagers are incredibly awesome, but they are ridiculously and easily abused in the current build. If you really want OP features for the sake of OP features (despite balancing actually making games fun), then there are plenty of mods or add-ons that add OP features. This change would be healthy for vanilla Minecraft and would stop ridiculous trading halls while maintaining Villagers' usefulness.

For those that disagree. I am so sick and tired of this fix break mentality that instead of charging the problem head-on we tac on more "balancing" as a bandaid fix. Example: Mending was introduce to combat anvil repair costs, Mojang added mending and now it's op all of a sudden and now we have to change it. Sometimes i think mojang and it's community's version of "game balancing" isn't really fixing the problem but also creating more. Villager farms and breeders took far more time to invest into back then and now are only this powerful due to the Village and Pillage update which is nice because it's convenient, sure. But also created more problems because of that convenience. Before you put your "game balancing" hat on and you need to ask what kind of game this is and it's history. I fail to encounter anyone that can convince me that Minecraft's objective in the long run was always to focus on game balancing. Not to mention forcing players into a play-style which should be left up to the player. If what these people want comes from truth and then they turn around and make a mob farm then you completely lost the point and the argument. I am not catering to this hypocrisy riddled opinion based on ignorance especially when talking about something important like proper game design balancing. Not just another fix break band-aid fix like everyone proposes. It's pretty sad that at this point beta minecraft remains to this day the most balanced. Stripping all the eye candy away.

Responding to the above post. First, unless you were also ok with the mace in its pre-balance state your argument is invalid. Second, survival Minecraft is fun because it is a challenge. It needs to be differentiated from creative, which is the true snadbox sandbox mode. Survival has progression and that progression is broken by villager trading farms.

I agree make it an option not a forced change. It takes hours to make a good trading hall now. The people that want the rebalnce can use it and those that don't won't. Why punish everyone. Make it a game option.

Man, if you said making the game more grindy is the answer to balance the game, you're very wrong. Imagine using RSG to start your game and swamp biome is nowhere to be found. Guess, no mending for this gameplay! The true problem itself isn't the mending enchantment, it's the durability mechanic! Just add durability mechanic toggle and we have a peace. mending is just like that toggle, it's turning off the durability mechanic making the game less grindy and you can actual play the game! Not wasting your entire gameplay to grind another material for great tool you already obtain, Or move a pair villager from 3000 blocks away. What a challengeful gameplay! You're very skilled player! you could Travel villagers from 3000+ blocks away! Are that gameplay what you enjoy? There's no skill required for durability. All you can do is have a lot of resource and time to grind or just turn it off with mending.

Edit: if you really really really desperate player for exploring, add more value on the each biome! Give each biome exclusive useful mob or whatever useful or fun to encouñter it! Not taking other biome value and throw it to another biome. Just don't make this game too grindy, not everyone have spare time to waste...

I’m not a skilled Minecraft player by any means, and having OP villagers makes this game playable for me. Without them, I honestly wouldn’t have the time or patience to play a good survival world, and as lame as it sounds, I think a lot of beginner and unskilled players can agree with me. Optional is best because then the more skilled players can get a challenge, while us newbies don’t have to strain ourselves too much

My poll has been getting a lot attention lately so i will continue where I'm coming from. When talking about Village and Pillage my main concern with it was the Fletcher being able to buy sticks instead of going Farmer and having your crops take time to grow. I wouldn't be opposed to nerfing this by removing the ability to sell sticks altogether. Not to mention anvil repair costs although that's a different rabbit hole in it of itself.
When it comes to having a challenging experience that's fine. But before 1.20.2 I'd argue that the game encourage you to accept a challenge because of how the zombie villager curing mechanics worked. You needed to be on Hard Mode otherwise your villager had a chance to die in the process and the best part was if you ever did anything cheeky like switch it to peaceful when a zombie took your gear after death, you would lose that gear the zombie picked up. These mechanics in my eyes pushed casual players into a harder experience and some players like me would opt to lock the difficulty on hard mode all the time as the downsides into complacency were too great to exploit changing the difficulty all the time. All for a few added benefits. Was it easier to gear diamond gear? Yes! But would it be the same difficulty if you had done it otherwise? That's the question I'm proposing. I love catch 22s like this in gaming because it exposes a fallacy in playing the easier difficulty and encourages critical thinking when actually playing the game.

I agree that the new biome-specific villager trades should be optional. I understand current trades are kinda OP though; then again, what you usually see online - with villagers trapped in trading holes, selling level 5 trades for an emerald apiece - is usually the pro Minecraft players abusing them to get the best trades quickly. Rarely would an average player do that.

It would be fair if the new biome-specific villager trades were default in hard or hardcore mode, upon world creation, and cured zombie villagers would reset their all trades; or another idea is to reserve very OP trades like Mending or Unbreaking 3 for level 5 Librarian villager trades. 

But please. I don't mean to repeat too much, but it would be a pain for average or new players to have to transport different villagers across thousands of blocks; also villager abuse on the pros' side wouldn't even stop. Please Mojang, leave it optional. Thank you :)
Thank you! I made a post as well. It's nice to see someone else also agrees with the premise that larger amounts of time spent do not always equal gameplay that is more fun.

To complete the game, you don’t need enchantment at all, like potions, like beacon.
What makes you think that everyone you meet should have maximum enchantments?
Let the maximum enchantment be for those who really do it as a sorcerer, as players who really make potions as brewers or build huge farms as engineers.

I love playing Minecraft with these trades, I really like it, it's very fun and I spend hours making trades, it's very difficult and boring to exceed the enchantments that one wants without the villagers
YES!! I cannot believe that mojang plans to make enchantments even harder to get in a new update, since anything other than villagers is already basically impossible on a practical level.
bonne idée
Thats a wonderfull idea
New Mob....It's Cool idea/....Maybe he will sell torches, invisibility potions, a rare enchantment book or exchange ore.
amazing no a wither head i would say that is a very good idea

Love this idea. A blue 'policeman' villager that looks like a Pillager only not grey and overly cranky. They could wander about and function like Iron Golems. I also like the idea of being able to click on villagers and give them armour, boots, pumpkin heads or whatever. So annoying when they just run around in circles and let other mobs hit them until they die.

A nice little "go away" option in that click on and trade-upgrade might be nice too. The number of times they stick their face in front of what you're trying to build or trash is astonishing. You'd think they'd learn, but no, they watch their mate cop a set of stairs to the face mid-happy dance, then die, and the majority of them just stare at you and say "hmm" in a disapproving manner. If you're lucky, one at the back might adopt an "I'm out" attitude and leg-it for a while.

This idea is good but Mojang already made it clear that villagers are never going to fight in anyway shape or form. However I would love if Mojang added this but change villagers to golems make a new type of golem, same appearance as the player but wearing knight helmet with their own unique armor set (like pillagers have their unique armor look) if the community would focus more on improving golems or adding a entirely new type of humanoid npc like piglins to Minecraft maybe something like this or similar would get added . 👍
yea to see them train and have an entire bluiding,/camp site they train in or get weapon/make them they selves
Man, this idea is cool, i'll wait for minecraft's response for this
I have the same idea and villager will have more interaction like their quest is for you to wander around a near cave and collect bone meals. It would be awesome if Mojang make it come true.

Totally agree, was just looking to see why my Farmer Stopped trading and found this post.
Please Mojang add egg trading back again in a future update....
Agreed. Parity is good, but dropping the egg trade was a mistake.
Yes, I have lots of eggs I was using for trading, I don't make cakes or pumpkin pies, so now useless for me.
I totally agree, now I have a chicken farm and farms of all types for food I have no use for eggs, so having a trade with a villager would be a great way to have a use for eggs
Mutant egg

It is now 2025, and we STILL need the Egg Trade restored!

Parity should make the game better for both platforms, a "positive" improvement, not a Negative improvement.  This was a negative parity change, removing from Bedrock because Java did not have it.  It should be added to both platforms.

     If the desire was to make it harder to get emeralds because eggs can be farmed, then
- raise the trade to 64 per emerald. (lots of other farm items ARE farmed for trading).
- Make it a higher tier in the trading process so folks have to work up to it...maybe just below golden carrots or glistening melon

Please restore the ability to trade eggs with Village Farmers.
You could buy wood from him! Maybe he could go around planting trees too?

Perhaps the workstation would be called the woodcutter or something. Perhaps its crafting recipe would be like a stonecutter, except that the stone is replaced with wood, and the iron ingot replaced with copper or flint.

Here are some ideas for them

They would wear a red plaid shirt and carry an axe all the time while they are working

They could cut down the trees around themselves

They would not attack, as they are scardey-cats, just like everyone else

They would trade loads of wood related items, like the local biomes logs, planks, doors, etc...

A sawmill block can be his workstation block
We can also cut planks into slabs,stairs,etc like the stonecutter and they trade only the wood in the specific biome they live at. And lumber jacks dosent exist at desert villages unless devs add a new tree type in desert like the joshua tree
You can also sell wood to him
I am a Logger in real life, and I must say I love this idea!

With the addition of Shelves in Minecraft and it needing stripped logs for their construction, now more than ever, a "sawmill" block similar to the stone cutter block is actually needed. Creating stripped logs requires hitting with axe while the log is still in the world and can only be done one at a time. Having the sawmill/lumberjack would allow for this be created in batches quickly. It should include the ability to turn not just logs into stripped versions, but the "wood" block to be turned into stripped logs as well. The lumberjack profession would be rather simple to create and would likely be a clone of the stone cutter profession but just wood centric. 
Please make this an update in the near future it is now an essential item for players and not just a "would be nice" item.
The ice golems needs to be strong and resistant as the iron golems and they are made of 4 blocks of ice and one block of lapis lazuli
And also make it snow around them?  Perhaps they could make a special type of snow that slows enemies as if it were soulsand.

I would like if they survive in hot places and be strong against blazes;

Weak to fire damage;

If they had the same look as iron golems but with kelp in their shoulders instead of vines;

And finally, I think that they would be able to float on water, but they go in random directions.
Non of the golems work besides the iron and you can do that in regular minecraft

that would be great. I have a custom village with a bell tower and every now and then I do a round of the village to see if any have disappeared and then i can't find half of them and I start freaking out until I realize they are all just bunched on the top of the steeple with no way down
literally had a dozen villagers stuck in my watchtowers for many hours of playtime messing up my "villager economy" before I realized this...

I believe villagers should be able to climb ladders, vines, weeping vines, twisted vines, and glow berry vines on their own free will, since this will this make it easier to build villages that are as tall as skyscrapers.

I like the idea that they could just switch to melee up close instead of just spawning with swords. Though that could be cool too.

Why only Iron swords btw? They should be able to spawn with gold or diamond too
Tbh, I hate it when skeletons pick up dropped swords. They just kill us so easily, that being said, I love the idea. Just reminding you that these will be wayyy more dangerous than you think.

I think having skeletons with swords would be cool. But maybe not just with Iron Swords, like what CloudierAgate05 said, also we could have ZOMBIES with bows. Why should skeletons be the ones to only have bows, if an undead skeleton can wield a bow, why not a zombie. These ideas can even go to the strays, husks, and drowned. And what about Wither skeletons in armor.
Some skeletons should spawn with swords and some wither skeletons should spawn with bows
I agree but it should be rarer and they should be able to spawn with any type of sword
It should be rare... like 1/20. I don't think it should drop diamond or gold though because that is too easy for early players to get that item if it's dropped.
I think it would be more cool if it spawns in desert temple like minecraft dungeons
